column4: So, has the desktop version of ubuntu have a LiveCD (boot from cd) option ?
Yes, the desktop cd is a live C
i mean all files, not just for the current user
Okay.  find has an argument to search for files by group owner.  So, if you wanted to find all files owned by group 'Pici' you could do: sudo find / -group Pici
man motd.tail for information. It explains it better than I can.
What version of Ubuntu are you on?

Odd: The  initiation script /etc/init.d/bootmisc.sh prepends a line containing information about the  system  to  /etc/motd.tail  and  stores  the resulting  file  in  /var/run/motd.  /etc/motd  is  a  symbolic link to /var/run/motd (the system can not assume /etc to be writable).
If /etc/motd.tail doesnt exist, just use /etc/motd like normal
I don't see any package like that in the Ubuntu repositories.
i know, also i didn't find any download link for it.
